revised_title: Investigating the Role of Domestic Fowls in the Transmission of Sleeping Sickness Virus
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine if domestic fowls in Uganda could act as reservoirs for the virus of sleeping sickness (Trypanosoma gambiense). They found that laboratory-bred and infected Glossina palpalis flies did not infect the fowls, suggesting that they are not a significant reservoir for the virus.
